projects.name: wizzy.js
projects.subtitle: A web page editor for web applications
projects.description: A web page editor that aims to shave off most of the time spent on building user interfaces for web applications. It is a WYSIWYG editor that lets you drag and drop components onto a frame and then export the code to be used in your web application. It is built using JavaScript, HTML and CSS and works with any web framework.

projects.name: img2pdf
projects.subtitle: Image to PDF Converter using AI
projects.description: A python application to convert scanned images to PDF format using EasyOCR, reportlab and PyPDF2. I created this application when I was working for a company that needed to archive paper documents spanning all the way to 1992 so that we could extract key information from them and store them in a database for use in a web application.

projects.name: Awesome Chess
projects.subtitle: Multiplayer chess, but with guns and explosions?
projects.description:
A real-time multiplayer game of chess added absurd rules. Players move at the same time and turns are on a short time limit. It is built using Node.js and Socket.io. It features a lobby system where players can share a link to invite anyone to play with them. It also has a chat system where players and spectators can communicate with each other.

Actually, can you even call this chess anymore?

projects.name: webtagger
projects.subtitle: A browser extension for building image classification datasets
projects.description: A browser extension for building and curating image datasets directly in the web browser. It utilizes the new Side Panel API to provide a seamless experience. It is compatible with the most popular Stable Diffusion LoRA trainer script format, letting you save your dataset as a zip file of images and text file pairs.
